constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: ASC Name: Area of Special Character (KTC)
KTCAAP Name: Kingston Town Centre AAP
KEYACH Name: Kingston Town Centre Key Area of Change

AIRCZ Type:: Heathrow Planning Consultation Zone: All buildings, structures, erections and works exceeding 90 metres in height (295.3 feet)Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Heathrow Airport Limited, c/o Planning Services, First Point, Buckingham Gate, Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH6 0NT

description: Change of use of first floor from Class E (offices) to Class C3 (dwellings) together with the erection of extensions and alterations to provide 3no. 1 bed and 3no. 2 bed self-contained flats
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

Any external lighting installed at the site shall be angled so as to prevent any spillage or glare beyond the site's boundaries.Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates, evidence showing that the development has achieved internal water usage rates of no greater than 105L per person per day have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. Once approved, any measures necessary to meet the targets shall be maintained throughout the lifetime of the development.Reason: In the interests of sustainability and energy conservation, in accordance with policies CS1, DM3 and DM4 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to the commencement of any development above ground level, details of waste and recycling facilities to serve the development to which this permission relates shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The refuse and recycling facilities as shown in the approved details shall be provided prior to beneficial occupation of the development and shall be permanently retained thereafter. The developer and/or their successors in title shall take all reasonable steps to ensure that all refuse and recyclable materials associated with the development are either stored within these facilities or internally within the building(s) on the application site, and that no refuse or recycling material is stored or placed for collection on the public highway except on the day of collection.Reason: To ensure proper waste management in the interests of the character and appearance of the area and the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy SI 7 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS9 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to the commencement of any development above ground level, details of secure cycle parking facilities to serve the development to which this permission relates shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.The cycle parking facilities as shown in the approved details shall be provided prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates and shall be permanently retained for that purpose and kept free from obstruction thereafter.Reason: To ensure that appropriate opportunities to promote sustainable transport are taken up, in accordance with policy T5 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS6 and DM8 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to the commencement of any development, excluding works of demolition and site preparation, samples of the facing materials to be utilised in the development to which this permission relates shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The development shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved samples.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Unless expressly authorised by this permission, the flat roof area(s) of the development to which this permission relates shall not be used as a roof garden, balcony, seating area or other similar amenity area, and shall not be accessed except for the purpose of maintenance or in the case of emergency.Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The site and building works required to implement the development shall be only carried out between the hours of 08.00 and 18.00 Mondays to Fridays and between 08.00 and 13.00 on Saturdays and not at all on Bank Holidays and Sundays.Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan and policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

A scheme of noise insulation/reduction shall be submitted to ensure that the noise level of 35 dBL Aeq,16 hour in living rooms and bedrooms during the daytime (0700 to 2300 hours) and 30 dBL Aeq,8 hour and 45 dBL Amax during the night time (measured with F time-weighting and between 2300 and 0700 hours) in bedrooms in accordance with BS8233:2014 shall not be exceeded. Where these levels cannot be met with windows open appropriate acoustic ventilation should be provided so that the room can be sufficiently ventilated. The acoustic performance of any passive vent, variable speed mechanical air supply unit or whole house ventilation must be sufficient to ensure that the noise level standards given above are not compromised.Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for future occupants of the development, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to the beneficial occupation of the development the applicant shall provide a scheme to the Local Planning Authority for its written approval detailing sound transmission reduction measures to be installed between the ground floor use and the first floor flat. The scheme shall be designed to be 5dB better than that given in Approved Document E (2003 Edition incorporating 2004 and 2010 amendments) of the Building Regulations (Table 0.1a, page 12). Once agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority the approved details shall be installed prior to the development being occupied and retained thereafter.Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for future occupants of the development, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

No development shall take place (including any works of demolition) until a construction management plan or construction method statement has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved plan/statement shall be adhered to throughout the construction period. The statement shall provide for:i) How the proposed development will be built;ii) Hours of working (which shall be limited to 08.00 to 18.00 Mondays to Fridays and between 08.00 to 13.00 on Saturdays and not at all on Bank Holidays and Sundays);iii) The procedure for loading/unloading materials;iv) The route to and away from site for muck away and vehicles with materials;v) The route for deliveries/collections to and from the site;vi) The protocol for managing deliveries to one vehicle at a time on sites with restricted access or space;vii) The protocol for managing vehicles that need to wait for access to the site;viii) Whether any reversing manoeuvres are required onto or off the public highway into the site and whether a banksman will be provided;ix) Temporary site access;x) Signing system for works traffic;xi) Whether site access warning signs will be required in adjacent roads;xii) Whether it is anticipated that statutory undertaker connections will be required into the site;xiii) The storage of plant, materials and operatives vehicles;xiv) The potential for impacts from dust and emissions during the demolition and/or construction phase upon local air quality and surrounding residents;xv) Measures for the laying of dust, suppression of noise and abatement of other nuisance arising from development works;xvi) The location of all ancillary site buildings;xvii) The means of enclosure of the site, its erection and maintenance;xviii) Wheel washing equipment;xix) The parking of vehicles of site operatives and visitors;xx) Meeting the requirements of the Low Emission Zone for Non-Road Mobile Machinery (where relevant plant or vehicles are being used); andxxi) The method of recycling and disposing of waste resulting from the demolition and/or construction phases.Reason: In order to safeguard the amenities of the surrounding residential occupiers and in the interests of the safety and operation of the highway network, in accordance with policies T4 and T7 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS7 and DM9 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.This condition must be a pre-commencement condition in order to be effective.

--- Officer Report ---IntroductionThis application is of a nature where the Council's Constitution delegates the authority to make the decision to Officers rather than it being decided by a Committee of Councillors.  Before preparing this summary report a Planning Officer has familiarised themselves with the application site, the relevant Development Plan policies and guidance, considered any relevant previous planning applications, and considered any comments made by those interested in the application such as consultees with specialist knowledge and nearby residents. By indicating that the development proposal complies with relevant Development Plan policies, the planning officer is taking into account the information submitted with the application, any previous relevant applications, any comments received in connection with the application and any other case specific considerations which are material to the decision.The Development Plan comprises:The London Plan 2021;RBK Core Strategy 2012;Kingston Town Centre Area Action Plan 2008; and,The South London Waste Plan 2022.This decision has been authorised by a Senior Officer (Authorising Officer) in the Development Management Service. Prior to endorsing the Planning Officer's recommendation, the Authorising Officer has familiarised themselves with the application site, the application documents, the relevant planning policies and guidance, any relevant history, and any representations received.Application SiteThe property comprises a three storey building situated on the eastern side of Eden Street in Kingston Town Centre. The building is currently vacant and was previously occupied by HSBC Bank. The building is not listed and is not located within a conservation area.Consultation 17 letters were sent to neighbouring properties. No response received.AssessmentThe application relates to the display of advertisements. The key considerations are AmenityPublic safetyAmenityThe signage would be to the front of the ground floor shopfront at fascia level.  The unit is one of a number of commercial units in the Clarence Street and Eden Street area and wider town centre which have contrasting styles of signage and methods of illumination. It is considered that the proposed fascia and projecting signage would be of a sympathetic addition to and proportionate to the existing host property and would not detract from its character and appearance and the surrounding area. It is considered that the proposed signage would be subservient to the host property and would not create visual clutter. The illuminance levels of 600cd/sqm of the signage is proposed. This is considered to be adequate within the small town centres as per Professional Lighting Guide 05.  Public safetyThe proposed signage would be static and would not obscure any highway signs or impede pedestrian movement. The proposed signage would not prejudice highway safety. ConclusionIn conclusion the proposed signage would accord with policies D3 of the London Plan 2021 and CS8 and DM10 of the Council's adopted LDF Core Strategy.Details of the Application SubmissionIn accordance with the requirements of Local Government Act 1972 details of the application submission were available on the Council's website during the assessment of the application.https://www.kingston.gov.uk/info/200155/planning_applications_and_permissions/263/find_a_planning_application_or_appeal--- Informatives ---Positive and ProactiveIn dealing with the application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive way.  We have made available detailed advice in the form or our statutory policies in the Core Strategy, Supplementary Planning Documents, Planning Briefs and other informal written guidance, as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably.

--- Officer Report ---IntroductionThis application is of a nature where the Council's Constitution delegates the authority to make the decision to Officers rather than it being decided by a Committee of Councillors.  Before preparing this summary report a Planning Officer has familiarised themselves with the application site, the relevant Development Plan policies and guidance, considered any relevant previous planning applications, and considered any comments made by those interested in the application such as consultees with specialist knowledge and nearby residents. By indicating that the development proposal complies with relevant Development Plan policies, the planning officer is taking into account the information submitted with the application, any previous relevant applications, any comments received in connection with the application and any other case specific considerations which are material to the decision.The Development Plan comprises:The London Plan 2021;RBK Core Strategy 2012;Kingston Town Centre Area Action Plan 2008; and,The South London Waste Plan 2022.This decision has been authorised by a Senior Officer (Authorising Officer) in the Development Management Service. Prior to endorsing the Planning Officer's recommendation, the Authorising Officer has familiarised themselves with the application site, the application documents, the relevant planning policies and guidance, any relevant history, and any representations received.Application SiteThe site is located on the corner of Villiers Avenue and Cranes Park Crescent. The site is occupied by a detached residential building. The surrounding area is residential in character and appearance.  Consultation No response receivedProposal The application seeks planning permission under section 73 to amend condition 7 of planning permission 19/01873/OUT to make the following changes The proposed amendments as stated by the applicant and shown on the deposited plans are: - Amendment to side windows in side elevation facing 73 Villiers Avenue including detail of level of obscurity which would be obscurity level 3. The changes shown on the deposited plans also include the two new windows approved under non material amendment application 23/02364/NMA.AssessmentThe changes to the side elevation windows approved under outline planning application 19/01873/OUT are considered to be both individually and cumulatively minor in nature. In addition the windows would be non-openable below 1.7 meters above finished floor level and have an obscurity level of 3. It is considered that the proposal would not -change the quantum or nature of development approved:- materially change the character and appearance of the approved development in a way that would be detrimental to either the character and appearance of the development or surrounding area. - cause harm to the residential amenity of existing neighbouring occupiers or future occupants of the development subject of this application- result in any highway safety concerns;- prejudice fire safety- or adversely alter the sustainability and biodiversity of the development approved.It is recommended that the changes be accepted and that condition 7 is made a compliance condition and the plans condition 4 is varied to include the new drawings depicting the changes proposed to outline planning permission 19/01873/OUT. It is recommended that the conditions attached to outline planning permission 19/01873/OUT are reapplied and modified where appropriate to reflect any condition applications that have been considered and a decision issued since the grant of outline planning permission 19/01873/OUT. It is noted that para 14.2 of the legal agreement attached to outline planning permission 19/01873/OUT states that the legal agreement will apply to future reiterations of the approved development subject of a s73 variation.ConclusionIn conclusion, the proposed development is considered to be in accordance with the development plan and there are no other material considerations which warrant a decision other than in accordance with the development plan.Details of the Application SubmissionIn accordance with the requirements of Local Government Act 1972 details of the application submission were available on the Council's website during the assessment of the application.https://www.kingston.gov.uk/info/200155/planning_applications_and_permissions/263/find_a_planning_application_or_appeal

The site comprises a semi-detached dwelling.5 neighbouring properties have been notified of the proposals and no representation has been received.The key areas of assessment are:- The design of the proposed development; and,- The impact of the development on the amenities of existing and future occupants of land and buildings.- Fire SafetyDesignWhen read together Policies CS8 and DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy (CS)(2012) and the guidance in the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Residential Design Guide SPD (2013) require proposals to be of a high quality design that respects the character and appearance of the original building and the prevailing character of the surrounding area.Officer Comment: Officers acknowledge that the proposed hip-to-gable would cause a visual imbalance to the adjoining semi-detached property No. 1 Bakewell Way as they do not benefit from a hip-to-gable extension. However, although not common, gable-end extensions can be seen in the vicinity, and the gable end could be constructed under permitted development if considered solely. The proposed dormer would generally comply with the guidance in the Residential Design SPD (Dormer Windows) by maintaining 500mm from the eaves, sides and ridge. Additionally, this could generally be constructed under permitted development, officers consider that this would be a subsequent solution. In addition, in the context of other houses in the wider area, this form of construction would not be unusual.The applicant proposed a single-storey rear/side extension that would have a depth of approximately 3m from the rear elevation and a part-flat, part-pitched roof totalling approximately 4m in height with a eave height of approximately 2.9m. The extension would have a reasonable setback from the front elevation of approximately 4m; therefore, it would not be starkly visible in the street scene. Overall, the single-storey extension would appear subordinate and proportionate to the host dwelling. On balance, the proposed development is considered to be acceptable in terms of scale, form, bulk, height, massing, spacing and design. It is considered that there would be no adverse impacts on the character or appearance of the area as a result of the proposed development.AmenityPolicy DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy (CS)(2012) and the guidance in the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Residential Design Guide SPD (2013) requires proposal to have regard to the amenities of the future occupants of the development as well as those of the existing occupants of neighbouring land and buildings, including in terms of privacy, outlook, sunlight/daylight, avoidance of visual intrusion and noise and disturbance.Officer Comment: Officers have assessed the impact on daylighting and sunlighting of the proposed development, using the BRE, 45 Degree Rule and the Residential Design SPD to ensure minimum impact on neighbouring amenities.Given the siting of the proposed development in relation to neighbouring properties, it is considered that the proposed development would not adversely affect the amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties by reason of overbearing appearance, loss of light or loss of privacy.Fire SafetyLondon Plan Policy D12(A) requires all development proposals to achieve the highest standards of fire safety, embedding these at the earliest possible stage.Officer comment: The applicant has submitted a Reasonable Exception Statement which does not sufficiently set out which policy criteria is not relevant to the development and why. Officers see no reason why a development of the type sought could not comply with the rest of the provisions of Policy D12(A), the details of which could be secured through conditions. For these reasons, officers conclude that the proposal would not conflict with Policy D12 of the London Plan.In conclusion, the proposed development would be in general accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework (2024), the National Planning Practice Guidance, the London Plan (2021), Policies of the Core Strategy (2012) and the Residential Design SPD (2013).

The applicant is informed that the submitted details have been assessed by relevant consultees and are hereby approved subject to carrying out the development in accordance with the approved details, in relation to conditions 3 (Facing Materials), 4 (Detailed Drawings), 9 (Drainage Strategy), 11 (Landscape & Planting Plan), 12 (Waste and Recycling Facilities), 13 (Cycle Parking Facilities), 28 (Ecological Mitigation and Enhancement Measures), and 30 (External Lighting) of planning permission 24/01386/FUL (Application under Section 73 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 to carry out development without compliance with Conditions 1 (Approved plans), 10 (Sustainable Drainage Scheme) and 28 (Biodiversity and Nature Conservation) and removal of Condition 34 (Green roof) for Application Reference Number: 23/01623/FUL (Demolition of Existing blocks EFAA, EFAB, EFAC, EFAD, EFAE, EFAG and EFAH, consequential works to retained Block EFAF, and erection of two replacement three-storey school buildings including temporary teaching blocks to be used during the construction period, along with access, landscaping, and associated infrastructure.) dated 16/01/2024. Vaiation to consist of Removal of Air Source Heat Pump (ASHP) and Relocation of Ground Source Heat Pump (GSHP), Removal of retaining wall & stairs (north of NB01), Removal of green roof , Change in main temporary teaching block layout.)The submitted information was approved under 24/00408/CLC for conditions 3, 4, 9, 11, 12, 13, 28, 30 and 34 attached to permission 23/01623/FUL approved on 23rd December 2024. Subsequently, a Section 73 application to remove the green roof element from the original scheme was approved on 3rd December 2024 (ref: 24/01386/FUL). However, as the Section 73 decision notice re-attached the 'prior to ground or above ground works' conditions (due to being issued before their discharge under the original permission), this application seeks permission of their discharge under the Section 73 permission. Condition 3Prior to the commencement of any development above ground level, samples of the facing materials to be utilised in the development to which this permission relates shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The development shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved samples.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.Officer comment: Urban Design Officer  was consulted and they did not raise an objection to the information submitted. The information is considered to be sufficient, as such the details submitted in relation to Conditions 3 is hereby approved. Condition 4Prior to the commencement of any development above ground level, detailed drawings at a scale of 1:5 or 1:10 (as necessary) of the following features shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority:Windows and doors, including any aprons, sills, mouldings, heads, jambs, transoms, mullions, lintels or reveals to a scale of 1:10. To include a key plan identifying location and types.Architectural articulation details (parapets, datums, recesses, material / cladding changes and interfaces, spandrel panels, brick coursing, plant room screens and other related). To include key elevations identifying location and types.Key elements of the building/landscape at a scale of 1:5SignageBoundary treatment (including a key plan identifying location and types)Solar panels (where applicable) Landscaping materials (including boundary treatments and surfacing)Details of rooftop plant and paraphernalia  The development shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved drawings.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.Officer comment: Urban Design Officer was consulted and they did not raise an objection to the information submitted. The information is considered to be sufficient, as such the details submitted in relation to Conditions 4 is hereby approved. Condition 9Prior to commencement of groundworks (excluding site investigations and demolition), a revised drainage strategy (clarifying what SuDS components are being proposed) that is compliant with the drainage hierarchy together with a revised drainage layout shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. A revised drainage layout is required to show the location of all the proposed drainage components and the connectivity of the system. The layout must also show pipe numbers, gradients and pipe sizes complete, together with storage volumes of all SuDS components.A detailed management plan confirming routine maintenance tasks for all drainage components must also be submitted to demonstrate how the drainage system is to be maintained for the lifetime of the development. The system shall be implemented and thereafter managed and maintained in accordance with the approved details.Reason: To prevent the risk of flooding to and from the site in accordance with policy SI13 of the London Plan 2021, the Sustainable Design and Construction SPG 2014, the Non-Statutory Technical Standards for Sustainable Drainage Systems 2015 and policy DM4 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.Officer comment: Drainage Officer was consulted and they did not raise an objection to the further information submitted as requested. The information is considered to be sufficient, as such the details submitted in relation to Conditions 9 is hereby approved. Condition 11Prior to the commencement of any above-ground works, a detailed landscape & planting plan shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.The plan shall include, where appropriate, a clear key or legend corresponding to the landscaping plan and providing the following information:Species (both Latin & Common names) for all plants.Locations of all plants or areas of planting.Plant numbers or planting densities.Sizes of all plants and particularly trees 'at time of planting'.Details of all hard-landscaping areas including materials and provision of shade for the benefit of pupils during the hotter months.The approved scheme shall then be implemented within the first planting season followingsubstantial completion of the development. The tree planting and landscaping shall thereafter be maintained for five years to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority. Any trees or shrubs which die during this period shall be replaced at the beginning of the following planting season, and the areas shown to be landscaped shall be permanently retained for that purpose.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.Officer comment: Urban Design and Tree Officers were consulted and they did not raise an objection to the information submitted. The information is considered to be sufficient, as such the details submitted in relation to Conditions 11 is hereby approved.Condition 12Prior to the commencement of any development above ground level, details of waste and recycling facilities to serve the development to which this permission relates shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.The refuse and recycling facilities as shown in the approved details shall be provided prior to beneficial occupation of the development and shall be permanently retained thereafter. The developer and/or their successors in title shall take all reasonable steps to ensure that all refuse and recyclable materials associated with the development are either stored within these facilities or internally within the building(s) on the application site, and that no refuse or recycling material is stored or placed for collection on the public highway except on the day of collection. Reason: To ensure proper waste management in the interests of the character and appearance of the area and the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy SI17 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.Officer comment: The applicant submitted a detailed waste plan showing volume and design of bins and screening details. Officers are satisfied with the information submitted. As such the details submitted in relation to Conditions 12 is hereby approved.Condition 13Prior to the commencement of any development above ground level, details of secure cycle parking facilities (151 no. long stay cycle spaces and 11 no. short stay space, including 5% of overall provision for larger and adapted bicycle) to serve the development to which this permission relates shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The cycle parking facilities as shown in the approved details shall be provided prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates and shall be permanently retained for that purpose and kept free from obstruction thereafter. Reason: To ensure that appropriate opportunities to promote sustainable transport are taken up, in accordance with policy T5 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS6 and DM8 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.Officer comment: Highway Officers were consulted and they did not raise an objection to the information submitted. The information is considered to be sufficient, as such the details submitted in relation to Conditions 13 is hereby approved.Condition 28The development to which this permission relates shall be carried out in accordance with recommendations, mitigation measures and enhancements set out in section 6 and 7 of the submitted Preliminary Ecological Appraisal (PEA) (Greenspace Ecological Solutions, April 2023), sections 6 and 7 of the Preliminary Roost Assessment (Greenspace Ecological Solutions, July 2023) and sections 3, 4 and 5 of the submitted Landscape and Ecological Management Plan (Greenspace Ecological Solutions, April 2023). Prior to commencement of above ground works, details of the above mitigation and enhancement measures shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved measures shall be implemented prior to beneficial occupation of the development (or commencement of any work on site where relevant to the construction phase) and maintained to the reasonable satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority and retained thereafter (as relevant) Reason: To safeguard the biodiversity and nature conservation value of the site, in accordance with policy G6 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS3 and DM6 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.Officer comment: Biodiversity Officers were consulted and they did not raise an objection to the information submitted. The information is considered to be sufficient, as such the details submitted in relation to Conditions 28 is hereby approved.Condition 30Prior to its installation, details of any external lighting associated with the development, to take account of the community use agreement, residential and wildlife requirements, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall be implemented and maintained in accordance with those details as may be approved. Reason: In the interests of the appearance of the development and the amenity of neighbouring properties.Officer comment: Officers are satisfied with the information submitted. As such the details submitted in relation to Conditions 30 is hereby approved.
Please provide a site location plan identifying the land to which the application relates drawn to an identified scale and showing the direction of North.

The assessment of this application is based on measurements taken from the submitted drawings / plans. If it transpires that the drawings / plans submitted are incorrect this would nullify the validity of this decision and you are advised to submit a fresh application with the correct information / drawings.

Heritage Statement - the Validation Checklist states that a Heritage Statement has been submitted, but this is not on file. Please can you re-send this? Please also provide a Design and Access Statement, which is required for applications for Listed Building Consent? Please see the Validation Local List (page 19-21) for guidance.
The Validation Local List requires Time Stamped Photographs of the site to be provided with the application submission. Please see the Local List for further guidance and submit these.

Please provide a Block Plan drawn at an identified standard metric scale (such as 1:200 or 1:500) showing the proposed works (hatched or shaded) in relation to the existing dwelling, site boundaries and any outbuildings on site. The Block Plan must show the direction of North and should also show adjoining properties to the side and rear and those opposite in full outline.Please also check the red line drawn on the Block Plan - the site seems to be differenct to our mapping system - see below.
